title: Beans and Greens Toasts
introduction: Southern Italy offers a delightful combination of creamy beans served with cooked greens like broccoli rabe, chicory, or escarole. Adapted for these crostini, the Beans and Greens Toasts are perfect as a knife-and-fork meal over toasted Italian bread.
ingredients: 2 large garlic cloves, peeled and chopped fine
1 small dried chile (peperoncino preferred), crushed, or a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes
1 pound broccoli rabe, chicory, or escarole, washed, trimmed, and cut into bite-size pieces
2 cups cooked dried or canned cranberry or cannellini beans, drained
instructions: In a large saucepan, put 3 tablespoons of the oil, half the garlic, and all of the red pepper. Cook over medium heat until sizzling, about 1 minute.
Add the greens, 1/4 cup water, and salt to taste. Cover and lower the heat. Cook until the greens are tender, about 10 minutes for broccoli rabe or chicory and 5 minutes for spinach.

Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and garlic 1 minute. Stir in the beans, cover, and cook over low heat until heated through, about 4 minutes. Coarsely mash the beans. Season to taste.
Place a barbecue grill or broiler rack about 5 inches away from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler.

Toast the bread on one side until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn the bread and toast the other side, about 2 minutes. Spread the toast with the beans. Top with the greens and a spoonful of their cooking liquid. Serve immediately.
